B0XDx8c0wcOKj1PQNtaflw.text: This is a great place to meet your friends before a night out in Soho. A short walk from Leicester Square tube and located just back from Charing Cross Road, this triangular shaped pub is packed to the (three) corners with comfy chairs and tables to spend a few hours at with your mates. There is a nice range of real ales and lagers available, and some fine pub grub on offer as well. I've heard there's live music here sometimes and friends have said it's really good then. I like the mix of tourists and office workers and passers-by. Oh, and it's close to loads of theatres - if you are going to see Spamalot then this is a good place for a pre play pint!

hWXUtNyVTESvbWq9R3dmnA.text: We met the manager on our first day in London and he was extremely friendly and willing to answer all of our American questions about London life and culture. Drink prices are so-so, and the food portions are very generous.

vC3RHgjbfOH_MORI_85LdA.text: This place on the everyday is a standard soho pub. The place is nice inside and can be a good meeting point due to its position. But I can recommend the jazz on a Sunday, down-stairs for a small fee you can see great musicians. Also for those who play Jazz it can be fun to bring an instrument and Jam.

BpCdb75GwJELvk4QCjBIiA.text: some great music here for a low entrance fee. at times you can be amazed as to what you hear. round the corner from a million bars its a great stop. it has a lot of space upsatairs and just enough down.

j3DOj2nNd1ETdRwyVOlIdQ.text: I had their Sunday roast, and it was great. Meat was delicious.

hX1kjPm2S90cUBc1ckegHg.text: Stuck on Charing Cross road/Soho/etc?Want to find a decent boozer?Spice of life has decent food, a good range of ales & beers, and a pleasant atmosphere all at central London prices. It won't break your bank... too much.Fair warning (and you'll be warned by the staff as well) to watch out - the location means that you may be targeted by pickpockets and the like.But all in all a nice place for a friendly pint without too much hassle.Probably one of the best pubs in the area (and they're a bit difficult to find) hidden right in plain sight.

wweMvwym3PXK0PsFccsyqw.text: Occupying a prime location on Cambridge Circus, at first sight it isn't that encouraging: the interior is large, the decor is unexciting, immediately after work it's ram-packed... But a little later in the evening, it gets less busy, and then you can enjoy the good choice of interesting real ales - unusual for this part of London - served by friendly and helpful staff. It has a loyal clientele alongside the tourists and office-workers attracted, in part, by the occasional live music, such as Jazz evenings. Overall, not a bad boozer for the area. It's also one of the few venues in the area with a disabled toilet and level access on the ground floor.

tHx6O3_cs0uDjrl5lts0uA.text: The Spice of Life is one of my favourite pubs in London - it is one of those dying breeds even in London in this day and age......a good traditional, friendly boozer! Location wise you cannot fault it, being on the edge of Soho and Covent Garden it is handy for many a mode of public transport and any type of night out, whether it's a simple after works drink, drinks before the theatre as it's in the heart of theatreland (and right next to the Palace Theatre), casual night with mates or a night discovering new talent at their Open Mic nights, you can get it all here. More importantly, you will receive friendly and courteous service and the atmosphere in the pub is relaxed and down to earth, nothing pretentious at all. Be warned though it is always busy and you can rarely get a seat after 7pm! I'm a bit wary of raving about the pub because it will go off the scale!

mrGzvjFzwNKt3Uzxtj_tBA.text: This a great spot for live music 7 days a week, if you are in central London.It is located near Covent garden so attracts locals and tourists alike.There is a live music venue downstairs where the likes of Bob Dylan has played in the past.Worth checking out if you are a fan of live music.

sg4L8PuocrKTq2NzFNDCUQ.text: The staff was fantastic here.  Very friendly.  It was obvious that this was more of a local spot rather than a touristy place.  Cider was fantastic, and the food was great.  Everyone at our table seemed to enjoy their food.  The crackly pork starter we had was a bit rich, but excellent.  It was a bit noisy inside, but that certainly made this place a great dining experience, especially from a couple of tourists visiting London.

znjoo_jJ26EQLP_s5ZuTvA.text: The Spice Of Life is a great pub - the perfect central Location for a night out. I have found Spice great for a whole bunch of different things; Karaoke downstairs, a social gathering upstairs - or during the day time using downstairs for work (they hire it out). I heard that they stopped doing karaoke a while back; which is a shame. Because it was a staple of our Sunday nights for a few months. Oh the memories. I have also seen live music here; and it's a good venue for that. Small and personal - their website says many famous acts have played here in the past, and I can understand why, it's very intimate. The staff are young, friendly and enthusiastic, which makes a big difference. Drinks aren't too expensive, from what I remember. You can do a lot worse on a night out in London. The upstairs is normally packed, you have to fight for a table. But once you've got one it's a good place to hang out; lively but not noisy if you know what I mean. This place is probably top of my list in the area for a little gathering of friends.

photos.caption: Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom

scAJ-VMcardTzhXlAotUWA.text: The Spice of Life is in perfect location for meeting friends, even those who don't know London very well. It is an old-style pub of the type that's disappearing from most popular areas: quite non-descript in terms of decor, but reliable and trusted.I hadn't been for ages and went last night to see a performance as part of London Jazz Festival. The downstairs bar is smaller than the main pub and provides the perfect backdrop for an intimate gig.Accoustics are good and if you arrive early enough to grab a table (looks like it may be a good idea to book in advance) you can enjoy a meal with the music. The food's decent pub fare, not quite gastro pub level (priced at around £7/£8 for most warm disches if I remember correctly).

PxFvl4a-2C51OKb2m_KQkA.text: Pretty good music and decent beer selection. A nice place for a drink although the food was nothing special. Also it's very crowded and noisy so good for a drink but not for a meal and chat.

-wWTJM-eyFpYomAvruMZMw.text: This place is my eternal meeting point of Soho and the West End. Heading to the theatre? Let's meet in the Spice. Big night in Soho? Let's start in the Spice. Afterwork drinks in town? Ok, see in the Spice? Shopping round Covent Garden? Yeah, let's have a beer first in the Spice.Why? Because no one cares who you are here. You don't have to be dressed this way or that way, love this band or hate that one, you don't even have to be sober to get in. A forgiving, relaxed and very central pub for all occasions. I like nothing better than to be supping pints in the warm summer breeze stood outside the Spice watching London to it's thing.

O_TJTcPW5lftk6dqa74EzA.text: Little English Gem. The Spice of Life is a warm, cozy pub in trendy Soho with the relaxed, friendly atmosphere that you would expect a typical English pub to have. The drinks are reasonably priced, the decor inviting and the facilities adequate. If you go there on a Monday night, you can catch some up and coming artists performing their latest creations at the open mike night. Just don't make the same mistake we did and sit around upstairs waiting for people to whip out their guitars and break into song, only to discover that the stage and performers were all in the room downstairs. Oh, you push up on the buckle. It depends on what you are after. If you want to be serenaded, go downstairs, but note that it is unacceptable to chat while people are performing, so if you are more into a social evening with mates, stick to the upstairs section. All in all a good evening out and a good way to spice up an otherwise boring weekday.

SSBj5E9dJ3L5aZ03gDCrMQ.text: It seems to be a busy place  I only could sit right at the bar. Not the best place, but it was okay. I ordered a burger and some wine and both went down well. So for drinks and food, I can recommend this place. But then I went down for some classical music gig. It looks like a nice venue. But for some reason the staff didn't realize that everybody was freezing due to the aircon, or didn't manage to turn it down. After the first act I asked them to turn it off, but it didn't really help that much, it was just a bit less freezing than before. That was really annoying. It were these days when it was quite cold outside, so you're happy if it's warm inside. But it was not. Second, for no obvious reason the microphone and speakers were turned on while a guy played his songs on the piano. This wouldn't harm, if it wouldn't result in infrequent crackles. Not the kind of sound you enjoy. The other ensemble, Ligeti Quartet (ligetiquartet.com ), actually needed microphones, so their really good performance also suffered from the crackles caused by whatever machinery in the pub. Third, there was one obviously drunk man, who couldn't shut up. If you're at a (free!) concert and don't like the music, you just leave quietly, don't you? Not him, he had to discuss this issue with his partner. And despite some people in the audience repeatedly pointed out to the staff that this was really irritating and annoying  even one of the performers on stage commented on this behaviour  neither the staff nor the guy running the concert made an effort to get this guy out. After these shortcomings, there's not much the need to mention that the staff behind the bar were not really aware of the music and also disrupted the listening experience with dish washing and the like. It is difficult to rate this place, probably I should go back for another gig. But at this gig, despite the good food, they definitely messed up big time.

T2gf86DmCNs4o9uR09sQpQ.text: Never been here in the evening But during the day it's a nice enough place to have a cup of coffee. Interesting bar staff  recommending a wine to a friend, once, we were informed that 'the Shiraz is 'f**king delicious!' She wasn't lying, though! I understand the jazz in the evening is a real treat, too!

V3WvoodiAJMmd59_F1onDA.text: I came here to watch a friend's band and had a drink upstairs before-hand. This is quite a run-of-the-mill kind of place, but really useful to have in Soho as it is a mix between an old man's pub and a trendy bar (reflected in the clientèle!). I didn't try the food (I tried to steal someone's order but got found out. All in the name of japes.) but it all looked pretty yummy - burgers and the like! Prices aren't that bad and they have a pretty healthy (or 'unhealthy', depending on your point of view) selection of beverages. Staff seemed to be very friendly when I went, adding to the mix by having a rocker theme about them! Downstairs is quite a small live music room, probably fit about 100 people at a squeeze with a bar and toilets for convenience! The sound quality of the venue is not bad for a small'un. good place to go for a few drinks or to get on the bill if you've got a band and want to get gigging!

5FD4vdz4FUDSFugwzrZbSg.text: The Spice of Life really does add some fire to your alcohol consumption.  Usually there are live bands or other types of events at this place that really ups the fun ante.  I got blind drunk at this place and enjoyed every minute of it.  The crowd is live and the scene only gets rowdier and rowdier as the night goes on.  This place is definite fun.

photos.caption: Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom

JFZM48n9bbynxuG-xx5zjA.text: The Spice of Life, once famously known as 'The Scots Hoose', is still a focal point for live music. It may not pull in the same talent as it did back in the day (for example Bob Dylan and Cat Stevens) but they still have a great eclectic mix of live sets. The Backstage Bar in the basement has live music every night. Monday is the open mic night and often sometimes attracts talented musicians. There's a great atmosphere downstairs and it's a brilliant place to listen to live music. They offer a selection of wines, beers and ciders all at the usual pricey London cost. However, The Spice of Life is in a superb location between Leicester Square, Covent Garden and Tottenham Court Road. If you're in the area you should definately pop in-day and night there's live music and they also serve food. However, they're not open til late (11pm) but since you're in Soho you won't be stuck for anywhere to move on to afterwards if you've got the energy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom. The Spice of Life

pS4ZpL48mJBzujunKPMZmw.text: The Spice of Life is one of the better venues in this part of central London. It is reasonably spacious inside, so it's often possible to find somewhere to sit even when it is busy. It's also air conditioned, which is great when it gets really stuffy outside. There is a small pavement area roped off for smokers. Although there's been a pub here since the 18th century, the present building dates back to 1898, and the original name (The Cantons) can still be seen on the facade. The pub has strong musical associations, first with folk music (Cat Stevens, Paul Simons and Bob Dylan played here), then with punk and more recently with jazz, although Saturdays still feature selected up-and-coming rock and acoustic acts. Th pub is now owned by McMullen, and features their real ales: Country Bitter, Cask, AK and their IPA, and the odd seasonal beer. It's a little expensive, but about par for the course for the area. I've not eaten here, but the food doesn't look bad, and you can get a main course for around £7, not bad for Soho.

maysVrFbnsOd2X_usDOJnA.text: Came here for open mic night and had a blast.  I didn't spend much time upstairs, but found the decor to be charming and the crowd to be very friendly.  Downstairs, the setting is a bit more intimate and comfortable.   Drinks were reasonably priced.  Don't know if it was specific to the night I was there, but the music was great! I loved all the local artists -- music ranged from jazz, soul, to irish folk.   Come here with an open mind and allow yourself to be serenaded with beautiful tunes. The neighborhood is great- an east walk to most public transits and located near a major intersection.  I have fond memories of this place; the inviting staff & customers + the warm atmosphere really makes this a place to visit!

wuc1RqDT5xBGE63z6-UjHQ.text: Lovely pub.. great for Soho and the writing crowd. A little gem full of interesting people..

50NiljLruc21zu3R6mn5cQ.text: Free blues jams on a Tuesday eve. What more can I say  totally fitting considering Soho is the heart of Jazz music in Britain. Wonderful.

eX3SAFRWnMeX2mYehb_4vA.text: Great,  friendly service.   They even took our order at the table when we needed a drinks top-up and more food.  We went in at lunch time on a Saturday,  and it was still moderately busy,  but the staff were friendly and made sure everything was tasting good.

yvaRXxMd7WowU78kwsKFag.text: The Spice of Life is a pub in central London, not far from Leicester Square - and right next to the Palace Theatre. It is owned by McMullen's Brewery, so most of the hand-pumped ales on offer are McMullen's, plus a limited number of guest ales and international lagers. The pub food is of a higher standard than usual - there are daily specials, too. The atmosphere is relaxed (except at peak times, of course - when it can get really busy), and the staff usually very friendly and helpful. It doesn't feel as cramped and chaotic as other pubs in the area. Toilet facilities are also far above central London standards.

photos.caption: Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom

ItNr_KI4tcVVH7lSEffgZg.text: It's safe to say this pub will definitely spice up your life! It's a Victorian style pub located in SoHo, and is designed with wood paneled walls and blue floral wallpaper. We stopped in on a Tuesday night where the special for the evening was a burger, beer and fries for only $13. I opted to try the chicken avocado burger, while my hubs ordered the four cheese burger. Both were Ahh-mazing!! The buns were buttery and crisp, and the fries were perfectly seasoned.Space feels very warm and welcoming, and the bartender greeted us like old friends. It made for a great last meal in London!

photos.caption: Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom

axada9TgnP19XIhz2jF_Kg.text: I as a London punk I met my American wife here in 1987.  We visit every time we are in London from the States.  Still retains it character and still a great pub in central London.  Last visit we shared a table with a bunch of Norwegian football fans.  Always a good time.

oc_HtmPwkS502-TvDZMTRg.text: Popped into this pub unplanned when hunger pangs grabbed us wandering Soho. We got the special of the day, a roast beef meal, as well as an ale and the famed scotch egg. The egg was eggcellent!  Beef meal and sides were okay, a bit tough, but with decent flavor. Decent meal for a fair price and quick service. Right across the street from the Harry Potter theatre.

icdZOH7pJGDfALfhhPPwUg.text: Came here to grab some fish and chips before a show down the street.  Typical British pub, order both your drinks and food at the bar and they will bring it out to your table.  The pub wasn't very crowded and yet was quite loud.  Can't imagine the decibels on a busy night.They have really great gin selection with very good descriptions.  I have really been getting into gin and tonics lately.  It was due to their fantastic selection that I was able to determine that my favorite gin is Hendricks - served with cucumber and not lime!We all had the fish and chips and shared an appetizer of popcorn chicken.  The poppers were very good.  (Cause the fried fish and chips weren't enough fried food for the night!)  We all enjoyed the spiciness of the chicken and the chipotle mayo was the perfect accompaniment.  The fried cod was okay, just not remarkable.  The chips really just alright.  The traditional smashed peas were probably okay as well but hard for me to tell because I am not a fan.Service was friendly enough.

photos.caption: Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom. Popcorn chicken with Chipotle mayo
Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips with minty mashed peas.
Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom. Interior, classic but loud.

ssKabTL0ddTejjTK74MVeA.text: Found another London pub that serves my favorite cask ale, McMullen IPA! Great location in Soho and very comfortable inside.

photos.caption: Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom

Npxco6ii3YNLTyrOkaJJ0w.text: My girlfriend got a really nice fish and chips here, and that on its own would've probably warned a 5/5; however, the burger I got was less than stellar, both small and rather dry, additionally I got some very thin and boring fries where she had amazing fat ones. They do have nice drinks and even some nice mocktails should you wish for it. Tl;Dr get the fish and chips and you may give it a 5/5.

photos.caption: Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom. A rough Hendricks gin and tonic but at least there's no lime in sight.

KoOHW0f-sYMdnw8y3uTLQQ.text: After the dinner we stroll down to soho...and discovered this hidden gem. On the basement, it provides a space for young local artists to show their talent especially on Monday evening. This is a free entrance live music performance as long as you get some drinks. It turn out to be very good and I really enjoyed. I would recommend this pub and would go to visit again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom

BAfth2dIXTkG8yvownulrQ.text: Great Pub in Soho. It doesn't matter if you want to drink just a beer or eat something, you always find someone to talk. The magic of Soho - chat.

photos.caption: Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom. Beef - Burger

nMmDdoofov3QcVd5PRG-Ng.text: My favorite pub in London. Monday night is the best as they have an open mic night in the downstairs pub area. It's so cool to experience the local and not so local talent. The service is great! They have brews from all over and a full bar service as well. I've had the sweet potato "chips" aka fries and they were tasty!! I definitely recommend checking it out if you find yourself in London Town :)

rvBRLsu1xYkbyUEATIqPlw.text: What a great little pub, they have a decent snack menu I'd suggest the popcorn chicken for sure. They also have more seating downstairs if it's too busy upstairs. They have a reasonable range of drinks and the staff are friendly, also they often have interesting shows happening downstairs including magic shows.

ywJKqadwSMpOCNhWkyTJow.text: Good pub for a jug of Pimm's on a sunny afternoon! They've also got pretty solid sweet potato wedges. The space is almost awkwardly large, but it's warm and welcoming.In contrast, the outside is preciously small, and the few tables are often taken up by smokers just hanging out and not actually patronizing the establishment.Muggles be warned- since it's across the street from The Cursed Child and just finished a remodel, I imagine this place will be crawling with witches and wizards for the next several years. ;-)

qQUgDIUUE55SxtT4zNdcmg.text: Got  the killer Camden lager and fish and chips, also wife got the beef burger with cheddar and bacon. The fish had limited taste but the beer is good.The burger is goodCool atmosphere

VB3EsQz8ape1gFcAl36Wdg.text: We stumbled upon this great pub while strolling around Soho, taking in the sights and sounds. I'm glad we decided to go in since who knew this was one of the BEST pubs in London's West End!This place was buzzin with both tourists and locals. Everyone seem to be enjoying a pint or a glass of vino. My bf didn't order anything else while we were in London except fish n chips. So that's what he had and compared to other pubs we've been, I love their fish here: no bones, crisp batter and mushy peas were so good. I've always been a skinny fries kinda gal, but their chunky sized chips here were a delight to munch on.My lamb kofta totally hit the spot. It was flavorful and moist with a small heap of couscous and onion and mint salad. The backstage bar downstairs is a neat place where you can hear live music every night of the week! (check out the website for the listings) and every Monday is open mic. A relaxed place where you can choose to chill out with friends or hear live music. With friendly bartenders, hot food that's delicious and jazzy music, What more could you ask for?

photos.caption: Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips
Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom. Lamb kebabs

etsFZrWuQ90VjYGKGJJtdw.text: The Spice of Life is my favourite pub in the entire world.  I live in Canada, but I make a point to visit here every time I visit London. They have the expected great local beer, but also an amazing room downstairs where there is  live music almost every day. It's an amazing place.

muRRe58SxPYOHYZ-rLl56g.text: Though I visited this bar close to three years ago, it still a great memory I have of a cool bar in London. The brews were great and the people were cool. Even though you didn't know them, they treated you like they knew you their whole lives. If I ever make my way back to London, this will definitely be on the list of places I go back to. Good times! Cheers!

7WkEI1klfVcieIo-lpMU2Q.text: During our trip to London, we stopped in this pub a few different times. It is a come-as-you-are, non pretentious pub. An interesting mix of locals and tourists. The drink prices are reasonable. (not the largest selection of draught/bottles but decent).  They have great live bands playing (especially Jazz).  We didn't eat any food here but from what I observed, the food looked good. We liked The Spice Of Life!

Zor0P7qre1eRI7IYDFhKAw.text: Spice of Life is a cool pub with plenty of room and ample outdoor drinking space. They have a couple of fun beers on tap but just a few. The staff can vary between friendly and curt.I mainly come here, because all-around this pub is pretty solid.

8Pu3YWS4O9B9XHbU2ZdzbA.text: Super nice waitstaff. Fresh and tasty food alongside a frosty pint. What's not to like?

photos.caption: Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom. Cool building and conveniently located across the street from my hotel.
Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom. A pint of something light.
Photo of The Spice Of Life - London, United Kingdom. Flat iron steak sandwich with beer braised onions and a salad. I added on the brown gravy.
